header.title: Das Necronomicon / Die Goetia oder Der kleinere Schlüssel Salomonis
header.category: Western Esotericism, Grimoire, Ceremonial Magic, Occultism

central_thesis: The book presents a combined magical system for practitioners to interact with and exert influence over a wide array of spirits, from planetary/cosmic entities (Sumerian-inspired 'Elder Gods' and 'Old Ones' from the 'Necronomicon') to specific infernal beings (72 spirits of the 'Goetia' tradition), through precise rituals, invocations, and the use of sacred implements and seals, while also offering methods for protection and counter-magic against malevolent forces.

structure_content.summary: Introduces the 'Necronomicon' as the forbidden writings of the Mad Arab Abdul Alhazred, discovered and encrypted by Gregor A. Gregorius. It contextualizes the work within Lovecraftian lore and describes the underlying magical system as primarily 'Moon Magic' with 'Sun Magic' as a counter-force, emphasizing ritual setup and protective measures.

Outlines the main sections: the testimony of the Mad Arab, a system of planetary 'Zonei', instructions for traversing astral 'Gates', specific invocations for deities (Fire-God, Watcher), and three core magical texts ('Maqlu', 'Book of Calling', 'Fifty Names', 'Magan', 'Urilia'). Includes a phonetic guide for Sumerian/Akkadian pronunciations.

structure_content.chapter_title: Das Zeugnis des wahnsinnigen Arabers, erster und zweiter Teil
structure_content.summary: Narrates Abdul Alhazred's encounters with cosmic entities like the IGIGI, Old Race, Gods, and Demons (MARDUK, ENKI, LAMMASCHTA) and his discovery of powerful seals: ARRA (Covenant of Elder Gods), AGGA (Elder Sign), and BANDAR (Watcher's Seal). It describes the immense dangers of the 'Old Ones' (TIAMAT, KUTULU, AZAG-THOTH) and the necessity of strict ritual adherence and purity. The second part deepens the cosmic horror, detailing the practitioner's vulnerability to chaotic forces and the signs of impending doom if precautions fail.

structure_content.chapter_title: Von den Zonei und ihren Eigenschaften
structure_content.summary: Details the cosmology of the 'Seven Gods of the Stars' (Zonei), each linked to a planet, specific seal, gate, color, material essence, and rung on the Ladder of Light. Provides specific planetary correspondences and their numbers, e.g., NANNA (Moon) with silver and number 30, NEBO (Mercury) with blue and number 12, INANNA (Venus) with copper and number 15, SCHAMMASCH (Sun) with gold and number 20, NERGAL (Mars) with iron and number 8, MARDUK (Jupiter) with tin/brass and number 10, and NINIB (Saturn) with lead and number 4.

structure_content.chapter_title: Das Buch vom Eintreten und vom Gehen
structure_content.summary: Provides practical instructions for traversing the Seven Gates of the Zonei, including a lengthy purification period (no semen, specific diet). It details the setup of a North-facing altar with specific offerings, the drawing of the gate on the ground, and the use of four lamps. The practitioner must carry the specific seal of the gate, circumambulate it, and then receive a personal name from the sphere's messenger. A special 'Ritual of Descending' for MARDUK's gate is noted as particularly dangerous.

Contains the specific invocations (often Sumerian-like transliterations) required for opening each of the Seven Planetary Gates (NANNA, NEBO, ISCHTAR, SCHAMMASCH, NERGAL, MARDUK, NINIB). These are presented as powerful linguistic keys for accessing and controlling the respective planetary intelligences and their associated forces.

Instructs on invoking GIBIL/GIRRA, the Fire-God (Son of ANU), for protection and offensive magic. The invocation commands the fire to consume enemies, sorcerers, and witches, invoking ENKI and MARDUK as authorities.

Details the summoning of the Watcher, a powerful entity from ENKI's lineage, for protection against malevolent entities. It requires inscribing the ARRA, AGGA, and BANDAR seals on a new bowl for offerings and driving a sword into the ground. The Watcher can manifest in various forms (dog, spirit, man) and can turn hostile if rituals are flawed or if not dismissed properly. Includes specific invocations (e.g., IA MASS SSARATU!).

A collection of banishings, burnings, and bindings against 'Evil Spirits,' primarily the Seven MASKIM. It details the ritual of burning effigies, the importance of clear recitation, and specific gestures. It includes the 'Exorcism of the Crown of ANU' for protection and various Sumerian-like invocations against the Seven and the Helpers of the Old Ones, emphasizing their destructive nature.

Outlines general ceremonies for calling spirits, emphasizing that the 'Power of the Conquerors is Magic' (ENKI's power). It warns of the dangers of the 'Old Ones' and their agents (ERESCHKIGAL, KUTULU, AZAG-THOTH). Provides instructions for ritual space preparation, offerings, circle drawing, and the sequence of invoking the Watcher and the Four Gate Spirits (North, East, South, West) for protection.

Presents the 50 Names of MARDUK, each representing a specific power gained from his victory over TIAMAT. Each name has a description, an associated 'Word of Invocation,' and a unique seal. These spirits are to be called upon after the practitioner has advanced through the planetary gates, with instructions on how to engrave their seals and prepare offerings.

A secret text detailing the cosmic war between the Elder Gods and the Old Ones, offering a creation myth from ABSU and MUMMU TIAMAT, leading to MARDUK's victory. It warns of the 'Old Ones' persistent threat and the dangers of their cults, emphasizing the importance of 'remembering' as a magical act. It includes the 'Hymn to the Old Ones' and specific invocations to these primordial forces.

The 'Book of the Worm' containing formulas for those who cause devastation, framed as prayers of tempters and blind devils of CHAOS. It identifies the practitioner with primordial power, stating 'I am the God of Gods... I was before all things.' It details the summoning of 'Abominable Offspring' of the Old Ones (HUMWAWA, PAZUZU, LALASSU, LALARTU, GELAL, LILIT, XASTUR), their signs, and protective measures. It provides specific invocations to these entities, along with dire warnings against their malevolent nature.

The 'Preparatory Invocation' for the Solomonic Goetia, invoking an 'Unborn God' (Osorronophris) and a host of obscure, powerful names (Ar, Thiao, Abrasax, Sabaoth, Iao) to make all spirits subject to the magician. This sets the stage for the specific evocation practices outlined subsequently.

Describes the 72 Goetic spirits, each a King, Duke, Marquis, etc., detailing their appearance, abilities, ruling legions, and specific sigils. Spirits offer diverse powers like invisibility (BAEL), knowledge of languages (AGARES), past/present/future sight (VASSAGO), healing (MARBAS), love (SALLOS), military tactics (SABNOCK), or destruction (ZAHRIM). Specific instructions for their evocation and protection (e.g., Solomonic Ring) are included.

structure_content.chapter_title: Goetia: Beobachtungen und Magischer Kreis usw.
structure_content.summary: Provides crucial practical guidelines for Goetic operations, including optimal moon phases (days 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14), specific metals for spirit seals (gold for Kings, silver for Marquises, etc.), and appropriate summoning times based on spirit rank. It describes the construction of Solomon's Magic Circle (9-foot diameter with sacred names EHYEH, LEVANAH), the Triangle of Art (for spirit manifestation), Hexagram, Pentagram, and the Magic Ring/Disk for protection.

structure_content.chapter_title: Goetia: Die anderen Erfordernisse dieser Magie
structure_content.summary: Lists essential ritual tools: scepter, sword, miter, cap, white linen robe, lion skin girdle inscribed with names, incense, censer, anointing oil, and pure water for cleansing. It includes specific invocations for ritual bathing ('Cleanse me, O Lord, with hyssop...') and for donning the magical robes ('In the sign of the Mystery of these holy garments...').

structure_content.chapter_title: Goetia: Die Beschwörung, um jeden der besagten Geister hervorzurufen
structure_content.summary: Details the primary invocation sequence for Goetic spirits, consisting of two main conjurations. The first invokes the spirit by the power of the Most High and numerous divine names (ADONAI, EL, ELOHIM, EHYEH, ZABAOTH, ELION, IAH, TETRAGRAMMATON, SCHADDAI) to appear visibly in human form. If unsuccessful, a second, more forceful invocation is provided, leveraging additional holy names (IAH, VAU, AGLA, IOTH, ANAPHAXETON, etc.).

structure_content.chapter_title: Goetia: Der Zwang und Die Anrede an den Geist bei dessen Kommen
structure_content.summary: If a spirit remains disobedient, the practitioner must recite 'The Constraint,' a powerful curse that threatens to bind the spirit in the Abyss or fire until Judgment Day, while burning its name/seal in a casket. Upon the spirit's forced appearance, 'The Address' is recited, showing the spirit the pentagram and commanding obedience and truthful answers to the magician's will.

structure_content.chapter_title: Goetia: Die Begrüßung des Geistes und Die Erlaubnis zum Fortgehen
structure_content.summary: Once the spirit appears and obeys, it is greeted ('Welcome, Spirit N.'). The magician then gives commands and asks questions, demonstrating authority. Finally, 'Permission to Depart' is given, allowing the spirit to return without causing harm, emphasizing the peace of God. This section also notes the option to command spirits into the Brass Vessel.

structure_content.chapter_title: Goetia: Tabellen der Indices und Weitere Korrespondenzen
structure_content.summary: Provides tables listing the 72 Goetic spirits and their corresponding activities, offices, and abilities, noting that some names and functions vary in different grimoires. It also offers further correspondences for understanding the spirits and their operations, drawing parallels to other occult works (e.g., Zohar, De Plancy, Scot, Barrett, Abano) and highlighting the synthesis of different traditions within this compilation.

Reflects on the book's place in magical literature, acknowledging its synthesis of traditions like Lovecraftian lore and Solomonic Goetia. It discusses the evolution of magical texts from astrological to ritualistic, the challenges of interpreting ancient names, and the underlying philosophical implications of commanding spirits for practical needs, portraying the magician as a solitary figure in a complex, dangerous cosmic landscape.

key_concepts.definition: The Seven Gods of the Stars, each associated with a planet, seal, gate, color, material essence, and rung on the Ladder of Light, representing a cosmic hierarchy for spiritual ascent and influence.

Human-allied deities (e.g., ANU, ENLIL, ENKI, MARDUK, ISCHTAR, NANNA) who are presented as having defeated the 'Old Ones' and formed covenants with humanity, offering protection and guidance through specific rituals.

Primordial, chaotic, malevolent entities (e.g., TIAMAT, KUTULU, AZAG-THOTH, PAZUZU, HUMWAWA) from a 'curved' dimension, whose worship is forbidden and interactions are extremely dangerous, capable of causing madness and destruction.

Three primary seals from the 'Necronomicon' section: ARRA (Seal of the Covenant of Elder Gods), AGGA (Elder Sign, key to the powers of the Elder Gods), and BANDAR (Seal of the Watcher, which must never be used alone due to its protective but potentially dangerous nature).

A powerful entity, from the lineage of ENKI, summoned for protection of the ritual space and the magician against malevolent forces, capable of taking various forms and requiring specific offerings and proper dismissal.
A class of powerful evil spirits, primarily seven in number, described as tearing out the heart of man and mocking their gods, originating from the ancient realm of MAGAN.

A hierarchy of infernal spirits (Kings, Dukes, Marquises, Presidents, Counts, Knights), traditionally bound by King Solomon, each with unique attributes, appearances, powers, and sigils, evoked for specific knowledge, material gains, or other magical operations.
A magical breastplate or pendant, typically bearing a sigil or sacred names, worn by the magician for protection during rituals and to assert authority over evoked spirits.

A primary protective ritual enclosure (often 9 feet in diameter) inscribed with divine names, designed to safeguard the magician from the evoked spirits during Goetic operations, keeping them contained and obedient.
A magical implement, central to the Solomonic tradition, used by King Solomon to bind and contain the 72 infernal spirits, and which can be used by the magician for similar purposes.

practical_system.description: The combined system offers a dual approach to operative magic. The 'Necronomicon' part focuses on a planetary ladder system, ritual purifications, and the invocation of Sumerian-inspired 'Elder Gods' for protection and guidance, and defense against 'Old Ones' and their malevolent servants, emphasizing an underlying cosmic conflict. The 'Goetia' part provides a detailed system for the evocation and control of 72 specific infernal spirits using Solomonic magical tools and protective circles/triangles, each spirit offering distinct knowledge or practical assistance. Both systems require strict adherence to ritual instructions, specific timing, material correspondences, and a purified state of the practitioner.
tools: Seals and Sigils (ARRA, AGGA, BANDAR, planetary/Zonei seals, 50 Names of Marduk seals, 72 Goetic seals)
Altar (North-facing, for Necronomicon; specific placement for Goetia)
Offering Bowl/Censer (AGA MASS SSARATU for Necronomicon, general for Goetia)
Magical Circle, Triangle of Art, Hexagram, Pentagram (Solomonic)
Sword (Watcher's Sword, INANNA's Copper Dagger, general magical sword)
Crown of Calling (8-pointed star, copper, precious stones)
Robes (black for Necronomicon, white linen for Goetia)
Magical Ring/Disk (Solomonic, for protection from spirit effluvia)
Purification items (wheat flour, sweet water, pine cone, golden brush, salt, hyssop, anointing oil)
rituals: Traversing the Seven Gates of the Zonei (planetary spheres)
Invocation of ANU, ENLIL, ENKI and other Elder Gods
Invocation of the Fire-God (GIBIL/GIRRA) for protection and destruction
Invocation and Dismissal of the Watcher (MASS SSARATU)
Exorcisms against Maskim, Evil Spirits, Possessing Spirits, and Hordes of Demons (e.g., Maqlu text, Exorcismus Annakia)
Binding of Evil Sorcerers/Witches (using effigies and knot magic)
Calling of the 50 Names of MARDUK for specific powers
Love spells and potency restoration spells (from ISCHTAR's sphere)
Preparatory and General Invocations for Goetic spirits
The Great Invocation of All Powers (Necronomicon)
The Constraint and Address to the Goetic Spirits upon their manifestation
Permission for Goetic Spirits to Depart

relevant_quotes.text: Es hat wahrscheinlich nie eine Zeit gegeben, in der nicht irgendwelche Gruppen oder Kultgemeinschaften das Geheimwissen gehütet haben. Im Necronomicon finden sich Andeutungen über die Existenz eines derartigen Kultes unter den Menschen — einer Gemeinschaft, die bisweilen einem Geiste, der durch die Jahrmillionen aus der Zeit der Großen Rasse gekommen ist, Hilfe gewährt.

Deshalb muß das Amulett auf reines Silber im vollen Lichte des Mondes graviert werden, so daß der Mond auf deine Arbeit scheint und die Essenz des Mondes heruntergezogen wird und darinnen behalten. Und die rechten Beschwörungen müssen ausgeführt werden und ebenso die vorgeschriebenen Rituale, wie sie in diesem Buche gegeben werden.
Wisse, daß die Bösen Geister hauptsächlich Sieben sind, denn Sieben sind die MASKIM, die das Herz des Mannes wegreißen und seine Götter verhöhnen.
Ich bin Er! Der Ungeborene Geist! Der Sicht in den Füßen hat, Stärke und das Unsterbliche Feuer! Ich bin Er! Die Wahrheit! Ich bin Er! Der es haßt, daß Böses in der Welt bewirkt wird!
Diese sind die 72 mächtigen Könige und Prinzen, die der König Salomo zusammen mit ihren Legionen in ein Messinggefäß befahl. Von diesen sind Belial, Bileth, Asmoday und Gaap die Oberhäupter.
Man beherrscht die Natur nur, indem man sich ihren Gesetzen unterwirft.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant as a modern (1980) German compilation that synthesizes two major grimoire traditions: the Lovecraft-inspired Necronomicon (drawing from Sumerian/Babylonian mythology and Chaos Magic elements) and the Solomonic Goetia tradition. It attempts to provide a unified framework for interacting with diverse spirit types, ranging from cosmic entities to infernal demons. Its emphasis on operative magic and detailed instructions makes it a practical manual. The commentary highlights the historical evolution of magical texts and the challenges of interpretation, while also introducing a 'cosmic horror' dimension to traditional Goetic evocations.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Experienced practitioners of ceremonial magic, occultists with a background in grimoire traditions, and students of Western Esotericism interested in the intersection of Lovecraftian lore with classical magical systems. The text assumes a certain level of prior knowledge regarding ritual practice and self-discipline, given the explicit warnings about dangers and the complexity of the presented systems.
